required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Baseline Visual Acuity on the Treatment Outcomes in Patients Treated With AflIbercept in Real-life Clinical Setting
clinical_study.official_title: INSIGHT - The Impact of baseliNe viSual Acuity on the Treatment Outcomes in Patients Treated With AflIbercept in Real-life Clinical settinG. Analysis of Data From the SwedisH Macula RegisTer

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will assess the mean change in Visual Acuity (VA) (overall and stratified by baseline VA) at year 1 and 2 of treatment with Aflibercept in real-life setting.
In addition, the study will ascertain the baseline VA in treatment -naïve wAMD patients who start treatment with Aflibercept in a real-life setting and it will assess the impact of baseline VA on the outcomes of Aflibercept treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 3±1 months, 6 ±1months, 12±2 months and at 24±2 months follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Change in VA (Snellen) at 3±1 months, 6 ±1months, 12±2 months and at 24±2 months follow-up in all eyes and stratified in the three groups by Visual Acuity (VA) at baseline.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 3±1 months, 6 ±1months, 12±2 months and at 24±2 months follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Change Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) in all eyes and stratified in the three groups by VA at baseline.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at 3±1 months, 6 ±1months, 12±2 months and at 24±2 months follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Change in LIX in all eyes and stratified in the three groups by VA at baseline. LIX: Jaeger/LIX adult A chart (Ortho-KM, Lund, Sweden). The LIX-chart is a standardized readability index for measuring near vision and it is used almost ubiquitously in eye clinics in Sweden

secondary_outcome.measure: Patients with Gain of vision 5-15 letters, > 15 letters; Loss of vision >5-<15 letters; >15 letters or Stable -5-+5 letters
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with Gain of vision 5-15 letters, > 15 letters; Loss of vision >5-<15 letters; >15 letters or Stable -5-+5 letters at the annual time points

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients that recuperate 20/20 vision
secondary_outcome.description: In all patients and stratified by baseline VA (groups 1-3)

secondary_outcome.measure: proportion of patients that recuperate 20/40 vision
secondary_outcome.description: In all patients and stratified by baseline VA (groups 1-3)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with no need of Vision Aid support

intervention.description: Treatment-naïve eyes with neovascularization AMD(Age-related Macular Degeneration), with the indication to be treated with Aflibercept. One and/or two eyes per patient.

study_pop.textblock: All patients registered in the Swedish Macula Register during the study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment-naïve eyes with neovascularization AMD, with the indication to be treated with Aflibercept. One and/or two eyes per patient.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Eyes treated previously with another anti-VEGF drug.
